newsitem.title: FRANCE: Microsoft names new president for Europe.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft names new president for Europe.

text.p: U.S. computer software giant Microsoft Corp on Wednesday named Michel Lacombe as president, Microsoft Europe, succeeding Bernard Vergnes, who will asume the newly created post of chairman, Microsoft Europe.
As president, Lacombe "will lead Microsoft's European operations which account for one third of the company's revenues worldwide," Microsoft said in a statement.
Lacombe, a 14-year Microsoft veteran who previously was vice president for Europe, will assume the new job on July 1 and will also have the title of senior vice president of parent Microsoft.

The firm said Vergnes, who joined Microsoft in 1983 as general manager and founder of the French subsidiary, would continue to play a key role representing Microsoft and providing "counsel and direction to the European management team on day-to-day operations and strategic business issues".

"By expanding the breadth of our management in Europe, we'll be better able to meet the unique challenges of the European market," Microsoft chief executive officer and chairman Bill Gates said in the statement.
